subsection.name: Can jobs be exported to LSF/SGE/other?
subsection.p: Yes and no. HTCondor manages execution of jobs within the directed acyclic graph. If the batch scheduler supports DAG job types, then it is possible. For example LSF can have the "name" of a job specified as a dependency...allowing a chaining of the vertexes of the graph. Not all batch schedulers support this.

subsection.name: Why another Workflow Management System?
subsection.p: MaPSeq offers a few distinct advantages over some of it's competitors. Here is a short list:

tr.td: Being service oriented allows for integration into other clients.

Leveraging the OSGi framework & Apache Karaf allows for quick developmental iterations on Pipeline creation by Pipeline authors. Pipelines can be created, altered, deploy, triggered, and removed without having to stop/restart the container.
JGraphT is strongly typed, and well designed, graphing library which is not tightly coupled to a user interface.
Use of HTCondor as a meta-scheduler
The addition of GATE plugins to extend cluster resources within the University domain allows for opportunistic utilization of trusted compute resources.
